messages.title: Get people back to work and raise living standards
messages.content: We need growth and more jobs. The biggest public spending cut we wish to make is to cut the huge benefit bill - now bigger than the deficit - by getting people back to work and off benefit.

messages.title: Labour's price rises and incomes squeeze are hitting living standards.
messages.content: We need to change that by: Controlling immigration. Freeing business to succeed. Making the banks lend to private businesses. Reforming welfare.

messages.title: How can we control the debt?
messages.content: We need to control the government deficit before it sinks us. We must cut wasteful and undesirable spending.

messages.title: Why take the risk? If you want an end to Gordon Brown’s government, VOTE CONSERVATIVE.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Most of the new jobs in the last 13 years have been taken by new arrivals. We need more of the jobs to go to the unemployed already here.
We plan attacks on red tape and a much better deal for small business.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Making the banks lend to private businesses
keyPolicies.policyDescription: At the moment Labour’s botched bank regulation means the banks have to lend most of their money to the government.
So it is worthwhile working. Be tough on anyone who fiddles the system. Be generous to those who cannot work through no fault of their own.

The UK has gone from being the fourth best country for business to being the 84th. That’s because Labour’s taxes and rates. That’s why entrepreneurs and big businesses are exporting our jobs and going elsewhere. Conservative will cut taxes, starting with National Insurance and the main rate of Corporation Tax.
To avoid big increases in interest rates like those Greece is experiencing.

issues.immigration: Most of the new jobs in the last 13 years have been taken by new arrivals. We need more of the jobs to go to the unemployed already here.
issues.socialWelfare: So it is worthwhile working. Be tough on anyone who fiddles the system. Be generous to those who cannot work through no fault of their own.

images.caption: John Redwood - Local man, national voice
